to put yourself or someone else on an official list for an activity or for membership in a group, or to accept someone in such a list: [ T ] We have enrolled eighty children in this day-care program. [ I ] He enrolled at Penn State University. [ + to infinitive ] She enrolled in English. enrollment noun [ C/U ] us

/ɪnˈroʊl·mənt/
[ C ] Enrollments at medical schools are down this year. Enrollment figures for next year are now available.
